message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

This paper deals with Natural Language Processing (NLP) and proposes a computational framework for topic segmentation and labeling in asynchronous conversations. The paper also presents two new corpora of email and blog conversations annotated with topics. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with the intersection of computer science and linguistics. 

The paper also uses graph-based methods for NLP, which suggests that it could belong to cs.IR (Information Retrieval) or cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). 

The proposed unsupervised and supervised models for topic segmentation and labeling also involve machine learning techniques, which could place the paper in cs.LG (Machine Learning) or cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence).
